p: Presumptive diagnosis of PPR is based on clinical signs presented in living animals and postmortem lesions. Such diagnosis in PPRV endemic zones could play an important role in early warning in disease-symptomatic surveillance when coupled to digital diagnostic technology [ 73â€“ 75]. However, definitive laboratory diagnosis of PPR is the key to achieving accurate result because PPRV infections manifest similar clinical picture with other diseases such as bluetongue, contagious caprine pleuropneumonia, capripox and foot-and-mouth disease [ 4, 23, 76].
